GOD.content: the speculative requires a heterotautological position (Hegel, revealed religion that is precisely Christian) [G], always risks meaning nothing, speculates on every secret [re: tout autre est tout autre]
GOD.linkedContent: the speculative requires a heterotautological position (Hegel, revealed religion that is precisely Christian) [G], always risks meaning nothing, speculates on every secret [re: tout autre est tout autre]

GT.content: credit, good faith, we lend each other in conversation; credit/faith as precomprehension that condition “tautology” of gift, and make gift impossible: “one” has to give some “thing” to someone other
GT.linkedContent: credit, good faith, we lend each other in conversation; credit/faith as precomprehension that condition “tautology” of gift, and make gift impossible: “one” has to give some “thing” to someone other

MONL.content: threatening & threatened promise, monolingualism & tautology, impossibility of metalanguage, but there are effects of metalanguage: at the horizon, spectral, infinitely desirable, allows the mirage of another language to tremble
MONL.linkedContent: threatening & threatened promise, monolingualism & tautology, impossibility of metalanguage, but there are effects of metalanguage: at the horizon, spectral, infinitely desirable, allows the mirage of another language to tremble

R.content: democratic sovereignty replaces theogonic politics with something just as phallocentric, phallo-paterno-filio-fraterno-ipsocentric (ipsocratic, though tautological, because ipseity already implies force)
R.linkedContent: democratic sovereignty replaces theogonic politics with something just as phallocentric, phallo-paterno-filio-fraterno-ipsocentric (ipsocratic, though tautological, because ipseity already implies force)

FL.content: all law wants to monopolize violence, tautology of the violence of the law, protect itself [autoimmunity]; performative tautology or a priori synthesis structures any founding of law, so one can “credit” the validity of each performative, guarantee
FL.linkedContent: all law wants to monopolize violence, tautology of the violence of the law, protect itself [autoimmunity]; performative tautology or a priori synthesis structures any founding of law, so one can “credit” the validity of each performative, guarantee

HERP.content: [re: Heidegger] what assures homology of to auton, the reversible tautology btwn polemos and philein, what gathers tautology w/ itself, is logos > “philology,” tautology is otology
HERP.linkedContent: [re: Heidegger] what assures homology of to auton, the reversible tautology btwn polemos and philein, what gathers tautology w/ itself, is logos > “philology,” tautology is otology

HERP.content: how is Heidegger’s monology, this belonging-to-one-another of Speech [shiz produced by polemos must gather, join up, ally, couple] different from speculative proposition [Hegel]? both synthesize an autoheterology, a heterotautology—too big of a question? [see p. 214 reconciliation in Heidegger btwn friend & enemy]
HERP.linkedContent: how is Heidegger’s monology, this belonging-to-one-another of Speech [shiz produced by polemos must gather, join up, ally, couple] different from speculative proposition [Hegel]? both synthesize an autoheterology, a heterotautology—too big of a question? [see p. 214 reconciliation in Heidegger btwn friend & enemy]

POOF.content: for Aristotle, it’s impossible to love w/out knowing it, science, self-consciounsess, loving cannot remain a secret, la force obscure mais invincible d’une tautologie [tautology & necessity]
POOF.linkedContent: for Aristotle, it’s impossible to love w/out knowing it, science, self-consciounsess, loving cannot remain a secret, la force obscure mais invincible d’une tautologie [tautology & necessity]

POOF.content: one cannot survive w/out mourning, not even God can escape this tautology
POOF.linkedContent: one cannot survive w/out mourning, not even God can escape this tautology

POOF.content: [re: Schmitt] structural disavowal that informs/constructs political discourse [that theory of politics must be performed, sides must be taken], principle of affirmation & ruin at heart of most coherent gestures > figure of tautology we were calling teleiopoetic [?]
POOF.linkedContent: [re: Schmitt] structural disavowal that informs/constructs political discourse [that theory of politics must be performed, sides must be taken], principle of affirmation & ruin at heart of most coherent gestures > figure of tautology we were calling teleiopoetic [?]

OOG.content: return inquiry [tautology]: geometry’s development is a history only because it is a history > ground of unity is the world (not finite totality of sentient beings), but infinite totality of possible experiences in space
OOG.linkedContent: return inquiry [tautology]: geometry’s development is a history only because it is a history > ground of unity is the world (not finite totality of sentient beings), but infinite totality of possible experiences in space

EM.content: for Heidegger, exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum

PP.content: writing stripped of its path-breaking force, pure repetition, dead repetition, tautological, hollow, repetition of death > writing is not living repetition of the living
PP.linkedContent: writing stripped of its path-breaking force, pure repetition, dead repetition, tautological, hollow, repetition of death > writing is not living repetition of the living

PP.content: two tautologies, repetitions: 1) life coming back to itself: eidos, logos, mnēmē, phōnē, requires dialectics, didactics 2) life going out of itself beyond return, unreserved spending, irreducible excess, play of supplement [can’t think these apart from one another]
PP.linkedContent: two tautologies, repetitions: 1) life coming back to itself: eidos, logos, mnēmē, phōnē, requires dialectics, didactics 2) life going out of itself beyond return, unreserved spending, irreducible excess, play of supplement [can’t think these apart from one another]

VM.content: for Levinas, concrete (nonformal) tautology or false (finite) heterology [compare to “false infinite”], along w/ the negative (work, history, etc.), never has a relation w/ other > no negativity in metaphysical transcendence
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, concrete (nonformal) tautology or false (finite) heterology [compare to “false infinite”], along w/ the negative (work, history, etc.), never has a relation w/ other > no negativity in metaphysical transcendence

VM.content: acc. Levinas, Being has impoverished logic of “truism,” [?] valid for every existent except “the Other,” subordinates ethics to ontology,
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, Being has impoverished logic of “truism,” [?] valid for every existent except “the Other,” subordinates ethics to ontology,

VM.content: if “truism” = analytic affirmation (poverty of tautology) > wouldn’t Being escape form of (banal) truism, where subject is repeated in predicate?
VM.linkedContent: if “truism” = analytic affirmation (poverty of tautology) > wouldn’t Being escape form of (banal) truism, where subject is repeated in predicate?

VM.content: Hegel’s speculative logic: living logic which reconciles formal tautology and empirical heterology [after having thought prophetic discourse in preface to Phenom…]
VM.linkedContent: Hegel’s speculative logic: living logic which reconciles formal tautology and empirical heterology [after having thought prophetic discourse in preface to Phenom…]

VP.content: “founding value of presence” is a pleonastic expression
“they [facial expressions] do not want to say (vouloir-dire) anything because they do not want (vouloir-dire) to say anything.”
VP.linkedContent: “they [facial expressions] do not want to say (vouloir-dire) anything because they do not want (vouloir-dire) to say anything.”

S.content: Heidegger’s spirituality would be a nodal resistance in its most economical torsion, a truth of truth, the tautology of which does not need to be discovered/invented: spirit as another word for the One and Versammlung [Derrida is presenting this politely as an hypothesis, but he knows it’s true]
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s spirituality would be a nodal resistance in its most economical torsion, a truth of truth, the tautology of which does not need to be discovered/invented: spirit as another word for the One and Versammlung [Derrida is presenting this politely as an hypothesis, but he knows it’s true]

S.content: how else but by confirming it a priori and circularly can Heidegger question Dasein’s privilege (Vorrang) re: the question? [hermeneutic circle?]
S.linkedContent: how else but by confirming it a priori and circularly can Heidegger question Dasein’s privilege (Vorrang) re: the question? [hermeneutic circle?]

S.content: that one can only think in German is a half-asleep tautology (confirmed by ideas of untranslatability of Sein, Denken, Geist)
S.linkedContent: that one can only think in German is a half-asleep tautology (confirmed by ideas of untranslatability of Sein, Denken, Geist)

S.content: Derrida reminds of Matthew Arnold, his Babelian phrase Get Geist, his claim that Geist is untranslatable > in Get Geist spirit apostrophizes itself, a beginning—no beginning (pas de commencement): in the beginning there will have been (ghost of future perfect)
S.linkedContent: Derrida reminds of Matthew Arnold, his Babelian phrase Get Geist, his claim that Geist is untranslatable > in Get Geist spirit apostrophizes itself, a beginning—no beginning (pas de commencement): in the beginning there will have been (ghost of future perfect)

T.content: Hegel: need for philosophy begins w/ itself

P.content: asking what art means, the vouloir-dire of art, tautology w/out reserve, logocentrism of question “What is art?”—teleology & hierarchy prescribed in envelope of this question
P.linkedContent: asking what art means, the vouloir-dire of art, tautology w/out reserve, logocentrism of question “What is art?”—teleology & hierarchy prescribed in envelope of this question

P.content: Hegel’s ternary rhythm—what he calls a “ring”—encircles, links to other rings: in science of beautiful, mind presupposes, anticipates itself > philosophy of art: circle in circle of circles
P.linkedContent: Hegel’s ternary rhythm—what he calls a “ring”—encircles, links to other rings: in science of beautiful, mind presupposes, anticipates itself > philosophy of art: circle in circle of circles

P.content: acc. Kant, sublime is absolutely large, w/out dimension, an unequal equal only to itself > why is there still reference to a cise in space? if absolutely large why not absolutely small? Kant’s preference of largeness is tautological: more is more (preference itself thinks more)
P.linkedContent: acc. Kant, sublime is absolutely large, w/out dimension, an unequal equal only to itself > why is there still reference to a cise in space? if absolutely large why not absolutely small? Kant’s preference of largeness is tautological: more is more (preference itself thinks more)

OTO.content: strict adherence to classical pedagogy (whose imperatives one can never break from once and for all) would reduce you to silence, tedium, tautology
OTO.linkedContent: strict adherence to classical pedagogy (whose imperatives one can never break from once and for all) would reduce you to silence, tedium, tautology

ATIA.content: Kant’s fundamental anthropocentrism, man possesses representation “I”: tautological, egological, autographical
power of “I”: “I can I,” a divine injunction that empowers man (not simply speak I, but think I, be present as self, as I)
ATIA.linkedContent: power of “I”: “I can I,” a divine injunction that empowers man (not simply speak I, but think I, be present as self, as I)

FS.content: Hegel demonstrated that explication of a phenomenon by a force is tautology; yet, one must consider this w/in language’s inability to emerge from itself, not solely w/in thought of force
FS.linkedContent: Hegel demonstrated that explication of a phenomenon by a force is tautology; yet, one must consider this w/in language’s inability to emerge from itself, not solely w/in thought of force

FS.content: force is the other of language [by articulating it, becomes a phenomenon]
FS.linkedContent: force is the other of language [by articulating it, becomes a phenomenon]

O.content: scriptural apparatus of Hegel’s opening w/ sense-certainty

tautology & heterology coupled together in speculative proposition > analytic/synthetic procedure mutually envelop each other: no more anteriority, belatedness of form, exteriority of content > concept enriches itself
O.linkedContent: tautology & heterology coupled together in speculative proposition > analytic/synthetic procedure mutually envelop each other: no more anteriority, belatedness of form, exteriority of content > concept enriches itself

SW.content: verdict: end of the end of history, everything is going to start again—is there a heritage looming at this instant/point of verdict? > I am no longer in question re: this unknown verdict, one that, if it came, would be so tortuous, so against the rhythm, that it would mime quasi-resurrection of new year by sealing forever the “so late, too late, sero” > “late” (always tautology) means “so late,” “too late, absolutely”
SW.linkedContent: verdict: end of the end of history, everything is going to start again—is there a heritage looming at this instant/point of verdict? > I am no longer in question re: this unknown verdict, one that, if it came, would be so tortuous, so against the rhythm, that it would mime quasi-resurrection of new year by sealing forever the “so late, too late, sero” > “late” (always tautology) means “so late,” “too late, absolutely”

DPi.content: must go from quasi-tautological opposition of life to death to a more specific opposition: opposition of life to DP
DPi.linkedContent: must go from quasi-tautological opposition of life to death to a more specific opposition: opposition of life to DP

Gi.content: [Heidegger’s tautology?] relation to birth/death speaks w/, supports itself through, dispersion, unbinding (Zerstruung, Unzusammenhang)
Gi.linkedContent: [Heidegger’s tautology?] relation to birth/death speaks w/, supports itself through, dispersion, unbinding (Zerstruung, Unzusammenhang)

Gi.content: Dasein’s btwn death/life not possible w/out dispersion
Gi.linkedContent: Dasein’s btwn death/life not possible w/out dispersion

PIO.content: inventive event as both quotation & narrative [re: “Fable”], allegory & tautegory > event of an utterance, its vis inventiva, inseparable from syntactic play, also an art of disposition
PIO.linkedContent: inventive event as both quotation & narrative [re: “Fable”], allegory & tautegory > event of an utterance, its vis inventiva, inseparable from syntactic play, also an art of disposition

PIO.content: there can be no problematics of deconstruction [this after wondering whether deconstruction can be inventive in itself]
PIO.linkedContent: there can be no problematics of deconstruction [this after wondering whether deconstruction can be inventive in itself]

RM.content: Heidegger’s nontautological fashion (like Sprache, Ereignis): trait treats or treats itself, traces the trait, retraces or re-treats the withdrawal > a strange contract that doesn’t precede, for once, its own signature (sa propre signature), and therefore carries it off (et donc l’emporte)
RM.linkedContent: Heidegger’s nontautological fashion (like Sprache, Ereignis): trait treats or treats itself, traces the trait, retraces or re-treats the withdrawal > a strange contract that doesn’t precede, for once, its own signature (sa propre signature), and therefore carries it off (et donc l’emporte)

WAP.content: [tautological] consciousness of stricture: being-right of right is its right to be right
WAP.linkedContent: [tautological] consciousness of stricture: being-right of right is its right to be right

WAP.content: invitation (Aufforderung) to tribunal of reason would be a repetition of old task (Nancy on Critique: philosopher pronounces law on law)
WAP.linkedContent: invitation (Aufforderung) to tribunal of reason would be a repetition of old task (Nancy on Critique: philosopher pronounces law on law)

WAP.content: Derrida now wonders whether Hegel’s philosophy itself demands that no texts [i.e. his “Report”] be minor [preface? not even a text?] > passage from minor to major is tautological, reproduces heterotautology of speculative proposition
WAP.linkedContent: Derrida now wonders whether Hegel’s philosophy itself demands that no texts [i.e. his “Report”] be minor [preface? not even a text?] > passage from minor to major is tautological, reproduces heterotautology of speculative proposition

WAP.content: Hegel’s system an immense school: auto-encylopedia of absolute spirit in absolute knowledge > never leave this school, mandatory instruction
WAP.linkedContent: Hegel’s system an immense school: auto-encylopedia of absolute spirit in absolute knowledge > never leave this school, mandatory instruction

WAP.content: Universitas: onto-, auto-encyclopedic circle of the State
WAP.linkedContent: Universitas: onto-, auto-encyclopedic circle of the State

AFR.content: Condillac: if there is fundamentally only one machine, there is fundamentally only one property > unique property assures possibility of “identical propositions,” this self-evident identity (nontautological) is discovered by way of Reason, is “the only sign of evidence” > all modifications are those of first property modifying itself: sensibility
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac: if there is fundamentally only one machine, there is fundamentally only one property > unique property assures possibility of “identical propositions,” this self-evident identity (nontautological) is discovered by way of Reason, is “the only sign of evidence” > all modifications are those of first property modifying itself: sensibility

AFR.content: Condillac’s non-Cartesian indubitability: first property which knows itself (sensibility)
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s non-Cartesian indubitability: first property which knows itself (sensibility)

AFR.content: need or desire? 1) frivolity comes to need through desire, desire opens direction of object, produces supplying (suppléante) sign, is thin, slight, inconstant 2) need is frivolous, need w/out desire is blind, no object, identical to itself, tautological, autistic: in such a case, desire would moralize need, subject it to law
AFR.linkedContent: need or desire? 1) frivolity comes to need through desire, desire opens direction of object, produces supplying (suppléante) sign, is thin, slight, inconstant 2) need is frivolous, need w/out desire is blind, no object, identical to itself, tautological, autistic: in such a case, desire would moralize need, subject it to law

IW.content: exemplarism (center of our reflection on nationality): our Beispiel (example) must be followed as a model (Vorbild) to recognize our Vormacht (hegemony, preeminence): if Beispiel is exemplary, not indifferent case in series, then this statement is a tautology
IW.linkedContent: exemplarism (center of our reflection on nationality): our Beispiel (example) must be followed as a model (Vorbild) to recognize our Vormacht (hegemony, preeminence): if Beispiel is exemplary, not indifferent case in series, then this statement is a tautology

IW.content: exemplary as a pre-model, a pre-formative model, an ideal
IW.linkedContent: exemplary as a pre-model, a pre-formative model, an ideal

EL.content: tautological & contradictory logic (speaks of the event of an impossible, makes of impossible the condition of possibility): secularization allows us to speak of a secularization that doesn’t take place
EL.linkedContent: tautological & contradictory logic (speaks of the event of an impossible, makes of impossible the condition of possibility): secularization allows us to speak of a secularization that doesn’t take place

TN.content: Nancy: “created body” is a tautology [what else but body is created?], body is the coming into presence as being this screen [no depth]
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: “created body” is a tautology [what else but body is created?], body is the coming into presence as being this screen [no depth]

TN.content: [heterotautology?] transitivism: flesh wants a hand, God’s hand, must go beyond hand of man, then come back to Incarnation, to flesh, to receive hand of man from God
TN.linkedContent: [heterotautology?] transitivism: flesh wants a hand, God’s hand, must go beyond hand of man, then come back to Incarnation, to flesh, to receive hand of man from God

TN.content: how to go from unfigurable to figurable (God to man’s hand) > question of passage, figural transfer—but one answer: passage, like Incarnation, Passion, Transubstantiation, mediation btwn infinite immediate & finite medium, btwn infinite & singular finite—is logos fashioned into flesh, the Son, the Hand of the Merciful Father [heterotautology]
TN.linkedContent: how to go from unfigurable to figurable (God to man’s hand) > question of passage, figural transfer—but one answer: passage, like Incarnation, Passion, Transubstantiation, mediation btwn infinite immediate & finite medium, btwn infinite & singular finite—is logos fashioned into flesh, the Son, the Hand of the Merciful Father [heterotautology]

TN.content: will is will to touch, strange tautology, bends oneself back into passive affect of activity—desire
TN.linkedContent: will is will to touch, strange tautology, bends oneself back into passive affect of activity—desire

E.content: logo-phonocentric system doesn’t exclude a negative, negative is its business, it’s work, it excludes what can’t be digested, represented, eaten, irreducible heterogeneity: vomit
E.linkedContent: logo-phonocentric system doesn’t exclude a negative, negative is its business, it’s work, it excludes what can’t be digested, represented, eaten, irreducible heterogeneity: vomit

E.content: tautologically, vomit never lets itself be swallowed thus causes itself to be vomited
E.linkedContent: tautologically, vomit never lets itself be swallowed thus causes itself to be vomited

E.content: to say that the other of the system of taste is distaste (disgust) is tautological, yes > Derrida wonders whether the tautological structure (that of logos as self-same-identity) is the very form of what the exclusion (of disgust) serves to construct
E.linkedContent: to say that the other of the system of taste is distaste (disgust) is tautological, yes > Derrida wonders whether the tautological structure (that of logos as self-same-identity) is the very form of what the exclusion (of disgust) serves to construct

EW.content: link the question of “who” to the question of “sacrifice,” phallogocentrism as a schema of carnivorous virility
EW.linkedContent: link the question of “who” to the question of “sacrifice,” phallogocentrism as a schema of carnivorous virility

EW.content: carno-phallogocentrism: a heterotautology as a priori synthesis, i.e. “speculative idealism,” “becoming-subject of substance,” “absolute knowledge,” “speculative Good Friday” > idealizing interiorization of phallus and its necessity of its passage through the mouth
EW.linkedContent: carno-phallogocentrism: a heterotautology as a priori synthesis, i.e. “speculative idealism,” “becoming-subject of substance,” “absolute knowledge,” “speculative Good Friday” > idealizing interiorization of phallus and its necessity of its passage through the mouth

BSi.content: “reason of strongest always best” is violently tautological [Derrida’s “gonna show” this tautology, but never does, thus (as the professor, as the strongest in the room) he does show it (a performative demonstration)]
BSi.linkedContent: “reason of strongest always best” is violently tautological [Derrida’s “gonna show” this tautology, but never does, thus (as the professor, as the strongest in the room) he does show it (a performative demonstration)]

EU.content: for Kant, that scholars alone can judge other scholars, a tautology: essence of knowledge as knowledge of knowledge
EU.linkedContent: for Kant, that scholars alone can judge other scholars, a tautology: essence of knowledge as knowledge of knowledge

EU.content: formal law: pure legitimation, reason as court of final appeal > pure ethico-juridical instance, tautology, pure practical reason, decision of pure egological subject
EU.linkedContent: formal law: pure legitimation, reason as court of final appeal > pure ethico-juridical instance, tautology, pure practical reason, decision of pure egological subject

SPEC.content: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time

SPEC.content: “[PP, the spool, ça, SA, Ernst, Freud] fait semblant d’eloigner le PP pour le ramener sans cesse, pour constater qu’il se ramène lui-même” [hetero-tautology? bringing it all back home]
SPEC.linkedContent: “[PP, the spool, ça, SA, Ernst, Freud] fait semblant d’eloigner le PP pour le ramener sans cesse, pour constater qu’il se ramène lui-même” [hetero-tautology? bringing it all back home]

SPEC.content: [grandson & son want each other to understand] but we know what a tautology can bring back by gushing over (peut faire revenir en dégorgeant)
SPEC.linkedContent: [grandson & son want each other to understand] but we know what a tautology can bring back by gushing over (peut faire revenir en dégorgeant)

SPEC.content: mastery of PP [grand (-père) spéculateur], mastery in general, Herrschaft distanced from PP only to reappropriate itself: tauto-teleology makes other return in domestic specter
SPEC.linkedContent: mastery of PP [grand (-père) spéculateur], mastery in general, Herrschaft distanced from PP only to reappropriate itself: tauto-teleology makes other return in domestic specter

SPEC.content: Bemächtigungstrieb, drive not reduced to other drives, takes place in others, quasi-transcendental privilege, donner, prendre, envoyer, destiner, transcendental tautology
SPEC.linkedContent: Bemächtigungstrieb, drive not reduced to other drives, takes place in others, quasi-transcendental privilege, donner, prendre, envoyer, destiner, transcendental tautology

SPEC.content: drive to dominate: drivenness of drive
SPEC.linkedContent: drive to dominate: drivenness of drive
